title: Wow! A real Keen comic???
content:
I bought this some time ago:[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-offended.gif[/img]
[url=http://cgi.ebay.com/ws/eBayISAPI.dll?ViewItem&item=6530025082&rd=1&sspagename=STRK%3AMEWN%3AIT&rd=1]Go to eBay[/url]

Well, first, it seems that it isn't an official Keen comic (no hints about Id etc.)
Second, it is not the Keen who we do know from the games. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

So, what about that thing? The text on the back-cover says, that this German comic was made by Hans-Jrgen Kelkel in january 1992. The title "Commander Keen und die heilige Blume" means "Commander Keen and the holy flower". The story plays in 2491 and Keens full name is "Kasimir E. Keen". There are many aliens and robots in the comic, but not anyone is from the games. Keen doesn't even wear his famous helmet, as you can see on the cover. So I don't know, either the name is only coincidence. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img]

title: haha
content: That's amusing--probably a fan-thing done not too long after the original games debuted, judging from the quality of the art.  You won the auction?  Any chance of getting scans?  :-)

title: Re: haha
content: Wow, this is interesting.. What are the odds that someone uses name Commander Keen and space stuff! Really cool. Not official stuff, that we can be sure of.. Nice find.You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: haha
content:
Neat find!
It's a pretty big coincidence about the name and what the story seems to be about.

A Google for the word "Piccolo" I was wondering about, along with the word "comic" got me the name Rina Piccolo, a Canadian woman that draws comics, apparently most famous for her "Tina's Groove".
It could be her... hard to compare the drawings with only 1 shot of the Keen comic.
I can't seem to find any proof...Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten.

title: Re: haha
content:
January 1992 seems quite close to the Keen era. I think it's a bit unlikely that it's a coincidence. Cool find! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
My [url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?grafix5000]MindBending Power[/url] is 5.43 points.

title: Re: haha
content: Maybe Keen returned in 1992 in form we couldn't guess (this comic).. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!
